Reason: The configuration option _journalDiskSync is performance-sensitive. The reason for this classification is that the _journalDiskSync configuration directly impacts the performance of the system at the system level. The code snippet provided shows that the _journalDiskSync configuration is used in the creation of a PersistentJournal object, which involves disk synchronization operations. Disk synchronization operations are time-expensive and can lead to notable performance variations at the system level, making this configuration performance-sensitive.
